listicle_content.listicle: Some of the students of the TG Higher Secondary school sustained fractures.
Examination in the DM College of Sciences were disrupted by the protesting students.
College Students\' Council leaders said that their stir will continue till Bruce and Vidyalakshmi are released without conditions.
The students are demanding the release of two students, Bruce and Vidyalakshmi.
The two students were arrested during the storming of political party offices announced by JCILPS.
Manipur is currently on boil as women activists have been pressing strongly for the implementation of Inner line permit system in the state.

story.storykicker: According to students, they were manhandled by policemen even when  policewomen were present.
story.storybody:
Several girl students were injured after being beaten up by police while protesting for release of two arrested students, on Saturday.

According to students, they were manhandled by policemen even when policewomen were present.

Girls have also accused policemen of passing lewd comments on them.

"After scaling the boundary wall, we escaped. However some policemen followed us," said a student, also adding that police allegedly passed uncalled for remarks at the girl students.

Condemning the act, students of CC Higher Secondary school took out a procession and later burned an effigy of Chief Minister O Ibobi Singh. A sit-in protest was also observed to condemn the attempts to deflect the people's movement.

Here's all you need to know:

{funfacts}

  1. Some of the students of the TG Higher Secondary school sustained fractures.
  2. Examination in the DM College of Sciences were disrupted by the protesting students.
  3. College Students' Council leaders said that their stir will continue till Bruce and Vidyalakshmi are released without conditions.
  4. The students are demanding the release of two students, Bruce and Vidyalakshmi.
  5. The two students were arrested during the storming of political party offices announced by JCILPS.
  6. Manipur is currently on boil as women activists have been pressing strongly for the implementation of Inner line permit system in the state.
{funfacts}

Students burned an effigy of Chief Minister O Ibobi Singh.
